trustfund:
TF024390-FOURTH HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF025950-PUBLIC SECTOR REFORM (CENTRAL
            BANK COM)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Sector Reform
            Technical Assistance Loan Project for Argentina were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project sustainability
            was likely, Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was also highly satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: technical assistance loans can be
            effective complements of structural adjustment loans in
            lending for reform. Bank interventions can be most effective
            when they capitalize on windows of opportunities that
            provide unique momentum to the implementation of reforms. A
            strong conviction on the part of the highest political
            authorities is required to sustain momentum during the
            implementation of reforms. However, the ultimate test is
            their final acceptance by in-house government personnel and
            the incorporation of technological solutions in day-to-day
            operations. A Government agency has to provide a
            well-defined vision of its future and clear specification of
            how to realize this vision. Consultants can add technical or
            managerial expertise, but they cannot instill the vision.
